document.heading: Sex Trafficking of Children Prevention Amendment Act of 2014

history.narrative: Law 20-276, the “Sex Trafficking of Children Prevention Amendment Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-714. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 2014, and December 2, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 6, 2015, it was assigned Act No. 20-560 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-276 became effective May 7, 2015.
